title: Dailyscript
author: Dailyscript
content: I don't want the year to come to an end without having any Bitcoin. I have seen a lot of people here talking about their bitcoins and how their investments are going. The thing that gets me depressed the most is when I hear about the halving next year and how bitcoin prices may be influenced positively. I wish i could just have some amount of Bitcoin. However, seeing the price of bitcoin now i became restless if the price will soon go higher and i may not afford it. So i pleaded with my parents if they could support me. Seeing how curious i am they helped me with some amount in my local currency so i used it to buy Bitcoin. Help me thank them for what they have done for me. Am so happy right now.This is the amount in my local currency i believe it will get me up to 90 dollars of bitcoin. I am waiting for my friend who will help me buy it by the weekend.Thank you mom, Thank you dad. And thank you Bitcointalk.

But notwithstanding, seems you've got a very nice family for them to contribute in order for you to be happy because I know you're very happy now that you've bought Bitcoin. You would have also made a more clear and precise detail image(s) of how you bought your Bitcoin.

comments.author: AicecreaME
comments.body: Congratulations OP for having a supportive family and finally having your Bitcoin. My only advice is that, don't ever do panic selling, instead accumulate Bitcoin as much as you can then enjoy the profit whenever new all time high happens. You could also look for services that offer bitcoin in return for you to have more bitcoin aside from waiting for someone to help you. You could start ranking up your account here by posting threads that are worth the merit to easily rank up and join any signature campaign that will fit your rank.

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: It is always a great thing to actually get what you want but bitcoin been funded by others donation isn’t it. From your post I saw how eager you are just because of the halving coming which is not kind of good because you are actually focusing on the profit side of bitcoin only without taking into the risk side. This money given to you by your parents doesn’t look like something you can afford to lose which is one of the focal points of buying bitcoin. Also since you already have the funds with you, I will advice you keep it in your local currency first and then go and have the basic knowledge of how to buy the bitcoin yourself from any exchanger and then set up a personal wallet by yourself, this way you don’t need to trust even a friend to do this things for you as it will be risky to do so

comments.author: DYING_S0UL
comments.body: Congratulations OP. You took the very first step to investing on Bitcoin. No matter what don't sell. Despite the price surges, if you hold it long enough you'll see the actual result. Many holders doesn't have that kind of mental strength to hold long. As a matter of fact, they start  selling when price starts to drop. Just buy and hold. Halving is near and I'll make the price go up again. The only thing you'll wish why you didn't bought more.I bought some when BTC was at 26k$ and now it's 42k$.

comments.body: This is a good way to start lad!It's good your parent came through for you in making sure you are able to buy your Bitcoin and I can only imagine how rewarding and happy it must have been for you seeing that you have a support system that has brought you dreams through.Accumulating an $100 worth of Bitcoin isn't a small feet to be honest, it might look too small for some people but I tell you it marks the beginning of a great journey that lues ahead of you in the future. comments.author: SamReomo
comments.body: Quote from: Dailyscript on December 14, 2023, 11:48:33 PMI am waiting for my friend who will help me buy it by the weekend.Why you are waiting for your friend when you can buy it yourself? I would suggest you to learn about Bitcoin buying and storing it safely in a wallet yourself because in the world of crypto-currencies trusting someone else is always going to be a risky thing. If someone gets access to your private keys then they can do whatever they want with your Bitcoin.Although, you have taken a good step by investing into Bitcoin but it seems like that you don't have much knowledge about Bitcoin storing or how to have your own personal wallet or how to purchase Bitcoin your self. I would suggest you once again to learn about Bitcoin purchasing yourself it's not that hard and then you should also try to learn about Bitcoin wallets. I suggest you to learn about Electrum wallet and air-gapped systems. You should also try to save your private keys and seed phrases secretly because if someone gets access to those then they can transfer your Bitcoin without your knowledge. When it comes to private keys and seed phrases then it's better to store those at 2 places one should be a proper SSD or flash drive that only you can access and that should be totally disconnected from internet based system and the other should be a paper. I would also suggest you to not keep your Bitcoin at online exchanges.

comments.author: Smack That Ace
comments.body: Quote from: Dailyscript on December 14, 2023, 11:48:33 PMThank you mom, Thank you dad. And thank you Bitcointalk.Have you thanked your parents directly? Because posting a thank you note on the forum won't make any sense when your parents aren't on the forum. Furthermore, do you have plans to invest in bitcoin, or do you just want to own some bitcoin before the halving just to satisfy your curiosity? I think that in order not to disappoint your parents, you should have a plan and do something now to create a result that makes your parents proud of you. That's something you need to care about more than showing off to everyone that your parents gave you money to invest in bitcoin.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: Congrats on entering the world of crypto. Now for the important part, you need to protect this crypto because there are tons and tons of scams out there.Your best bet is to use a hardware wallet but if you can’t find one in your area then just take an old laptop, remove the WiFi adapter and set up a electrum type of cold storage solution.It’s free and you will never get your crypto stolen.

comments.author: Assface16678
comments.body: Well, first of all, good luck with your investment and congrats on having money to invest. But the thing is, yes, it's a good thing that you have supportive parents or family that support your investment and support what you want to do. But the thing is, I hope you know what you are doing. I don't discourage you or say that asking for help from your family and friends is wrong, but you should not always hope that they have something to give you. Or, the important thing is, you should know the weight you have. Just because you have capital for investment from others doesn't mean you will not be careful in what you do. You should think about the people that support you.Don't hope that your investment will have an earnings return. Bitcoin is long-term and I hope the ones that help you have capital will also not hope for a return because you may end up disappointing them.

comments.author: Churchillvv
comments.body: It's a bold step to have a stash of Bitcoin compared to those of us who doesn't have but while trying to achieve a goal you shouldn't be pron to mistakes like not putting yourself in a good condition before investing. The fact that you're desperate to have Bitcoin shows your interest on the profit of the halving next year but well it's not bad after all the point for investment is profit making right ? but I will like to put you in the better direction, what I see from your testimony shows that what you have invested in Bitcoin is what you cannot afford to lose, your parents gave you money to invest in Bitcoin which means you're not the owner of your money, if unfortunately Bitcoin goes the opposite direction and your capital is lost what exactly would you tell your parents happened to the money they gave you? Which means you're not putting in consideration what is required for investment. mind you I'm not tryna criticize your action but make correction. instead of rushing to buy when you don't have something that you can do without is really bad but at least you got something so congratulations to your achievement. If I have to thank your parents I think they should be able to see this. Congratulations to them they have a son/daughter who's tryna make them proud.

comments.author: Sim_card
comments.body: OP, a big congratulations to you and I appreciate the effort that you family made to make sure that they were able to give you $90 for you buy your first bitcoin. It means that you family has made you proud on this as your dream have finally come true. What I want to tell you is that if you are not a student or too young, you should go get a job or something that will give you an income, so that you can start buying bitcoin on your own. It is good to use your own money to invest and not other people money, so that you will be able to grow your investment. This is because I don't think that your parents will still give your another funds to buy bitcoin. You should also take note that bitcoin gives profit when you hold it for a very long period of time and if you are thinking of selling this bitcoin in the next bull run, then you got it wrong. Hodli and increase your bitcoin through regular DCA.
